sentences: Cathy Lesurf (born 1953) is a British folk music singer-songwriter who was brought up in Stevenage, Hertfordshire.
She has been a member of bands in the 1970s such as Oyster Ceilidh Band, Fiddler's Dram, and The Albion Band.
She released a solo album, Surface, in 1985, the same year that she appeared as a guest vocalist on the Fairport Convention album Gladys' Leap.
She created and ran the World in 1 County festival from 2002 to 2007.
In November 2009, she released the solo single "This Christmas", which was written by her husband, David Wilson.
